questions.question: I told him ................................. worry.
questions.description: To make negative infinitives we put not before to.

questions.question: The teacher advised us .................................. hard.
questions.description: Imperatives are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: She asked me if I ..................................... for the drinks.
questions.description: A present perfect in the direct speech becomes past perfect in the reported speech.

questions.question: He told us ...................................... for him
questions.description: Imperatives are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: He told us ………………………………. about him.
questions.description: To make negative infinitives we put not before to.

questions.question: He asked me if I …………………………… them.
questions.description: A simple present in the direct speech becomes simple past in the indirect speech.

questions.question: I asked him if I …………………………… sit there.
questions.description: Can in the direct speech becomes could in the indirect speech.

questions.question: They asked me ........................................ quitting my job.
questions.description: When a question is reported it has normal word order. That means the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: She said that no one .......................................... her when she was in trouble.
questions.description: A simple past in the direct speech becomes past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: He asked me how ………………………….. react if I won the jackpot.
